newsitem.title: FRANCE: StorageTek says IBM deal going well.
newsitem.headline: StorageTek says IBM deal going well.

text.p: Storage Technology Corp said on Wednesday a deal signed last June under which the U.S. computer data storage company is supplying branded-disc products to International Business Machines Corp is "functioning smoothly."
It said that a U.S. Justice Department probe into possible anticompetitive aspects of the deal was having no impact on the agreement.
"Things are going very well. We are selling products to IBM and IBM is selling the products on to their customers," said a Storage Technology spokesman in a telephone interview.
The company described the U.S. Justice investigation as "routine and expected."
"We expect this deal to be very good for StorageTek, very good for IBM and we hope the Justice Department will find that it will be good for competition as well," the spokesman said.
Financial analysts have said that the IBM deal could add hundreds of millions of dollars to StorageTek's revenues.
